Posts.Title: Need a warm place to go... soon Kellke mommy23kids

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2012 06:41PM DawnV wrote: One month before my 52nd b-day I was dx'd with stage 2 invasive lobular. Now I am 58 (again I was dx'd 1 month before my b-day) and stage 4. Needless to say, I am changing my date of birth to something else!  I too am surprised how young some of you ladies are. This shit totally sucks!! Big hugs and prayers for us all Dawn
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2012 06:16AM - edited Jan 5, 2012 06:17AM by DawnV Was 1st dx with stage 2 invasive lobular cancer 10-2004, used to come in here every day and spend hours in the chat rooms. Then treatment ended and back to work so I didn''t come in much and finally stopped coming in altogether. Fast forward 7 years and now my lobular has pretty much taken over my abdomen with cancer cells in my stomach lining and colon. So what do I do, head straight back for here. The names are all different but the same love and support is still here, thank goodness! Being treated at UofM in AnnArbor and like my doctors. Had 1 dose of taxol with gemzar and tomorrow get ct scans and 2nd dose of gemzar. Got my fingers crossed and praying for us all. Love and hugs Dawn
Posts.Title: to all new stage 4 members apple apple

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2012 05:48AM DawnV wrote: Thankyou for the warm welcome back, I do appreciate it. Had my 2nd dose of Gemzar and don't feel so bad, just wore out. It is about an hour drive to UofM from where I live and think that is part of it. Scans showed nothing new so I am hoping it has not spread any further. Have to admit I am feeling much better than I was 3 months ago. Am thinking seriously about going veg, anyone have any fave recipes, or cookbooks? I am open to all suggestions. My daughter is a serious vegitarian but she can't cook!!! Thanks again for the welocme back, prayers to all. Love and hugs Dawn
